DataElement.preferredName: Prior Investigational Therapeutic Procedure Administration Elapsed Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response as to whether a patient meets the criteria for enrolling onto a clinical trial for questions related to the interval between the prior administration of investigational therapeutic agents that produce an effect intended to alter or stop a pathological process as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Investigational Therapeutic Procedure Administration Elapsed Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._In the process of being studied; experimental._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._The interval between two reference points in time._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:In the process of being studied; experimental.  (NCI):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: In the process of being studied; experimental.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Administration Elapsed Time Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:The interval between two reference points in time.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
The interval between two reference points in time.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient was on trial thera
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient was on trial therapy prior to study enrollment, has washout period of 6 times the half-life of previously administered investigational agents elapsed prior to starting Radium-223 dichloride?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received prior treatment with any other investigational agent within 4 weeks (or within five half-lives of the investigational product, whichever is shorter) prior to Cycle 1, Day 1 (minimum of 1 week between prior therapy and study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have greater than or equal to 2 weeks elapsed since any investigational agent administered as part of a Phase 0 study (where a sub-therapeutic dose of drug is administered)?
